author: Jenn Nelson
title: Te-Hina Paopao: South Carolina Guard Talks Basketball Journey, WNBA Dream
text:
Te-Hina Paopao‚Äôs road to the top of college basketball has been defined by more than just incredible talent‚Äîit's been about heart, resilience, and a relentless commitment to her craft. As a senior guard for the South Carolina Gamecocks, she helped lead the team to the 2024 NCAA National Championship , an achievement that reflects her drive and leadership under head coach Dawn Staley.
Her journey, however, goes beyond basketball stats‚Äîit‚Äôs a story of overcoming obstacles and pushing past limits. Now in her senior year, Paopao is headed toward the next chapter of her journey, with the ultimate dream of playing in the WNBA.
Te-Hina Paopao: Early Beginnings
As the youngest of six children, Paopao grew up with four older brothers who played pivotal roles in her early exposure to sports, particularly basketball. From an early age, Paopao was immersed in the world of competition, but it wasn‚Äôt just her brothers who introduced her to the sport‚Äîbasketball quickly became a personal passion.
‚ÄúGrowing up, I tried a lot of different sports‚Äîsoftball, soccer, volleyball‚Äîbut basketball was the one that really stuck,‚Äù Paopao shared. ‚ÄúI started playing in first grade, and from there, it just felt right. I loved watching my brothers play, and soon I was playing in AAU by the time I was in fifth grade.‚Äù
Her connection to basketball deepened as she began to realize the game‚Äôs potential to shape her future. Still, it wasn‚Äôt just her love of the sport that propelled her forward. She attributes much of her early development to a key figure: her AAU coach, who became a mentor both on and off the court.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve played for the same AAU coach my whole life, even through high school. She‚Äôs like a second mom to me,‚Äù Paopao said. ‚ÄúShe taught me so much about basketball, but also about life. She really helped me grow not only as a player, but as a person.‚Äù
Te-Hina Paopao: Family Inspiration And Legacy
Sports have always been at the heart of Paopao‚Äôs family. Her father, brothers, and uncles, including NFL Hall of Famer Junior Seau , instilled in her a deep sense of discipline, perseverance, and the importance of carrying oneself with professionalism. For Paopao, the lessons learned from these family members have shaped her approach to both the game and her broader aspirations.
‚ÄúFootball was huge in my family, and Junior Seau was a big influence on all of us,‚Äù Paopao reflected. ‚ÄúSeeing his success taught me a lot about hard work and the mindset it takes to be a professional. My dad passed that same work ethic onto me. It‚Äôs not just about playing, it‚Äôs about how you carry yourself and the example you set for others.‚Äù
Her family‚Äôs influence has been crucial to her development, providing her with the foundation to chase her dreams, both in basketball and in life. ‚ÄúWe always support each other, and that‚Äôs something that keeps me grounded,‚Äù Paopao added.
Te-Hina Paopao: Overcoming Adversity
Though Paopao‚Äôs natural talent was apparent from a young age, her path to success was not without setbacks. Early in her high school career, she suffered two devastating ACL tears‚Äîone in each leg. Those injuries were significant turning points, forcing her to reflect on her commitment to basketball and her passion for the game.
‚ÄúThe injuries were tough. It really made me question my love for the sport,‚Äù Paopao admitted. ‚ÄúBut they also taught me a lot about resilience. I learned that in order to succeed, you have to keep pushing, even when things get tough.‚Äù
The challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic also tested Paopao‚Äôs resolve, as the isolation and uncertainty of the time made it difficult to build relationships with teammates and adjust to the demands of being a college athlete. Still, these experiences only strengthened her determination.
‚ÄúCOVID was hard. It was a time when we couldn‚Äôt interact in person, and it was difficult to feel connected to the team,‚Äù she explained. ‚ÄúBut it was a reminder that no matter what, you have to adapt and keep moving forward.‚Äù
However, perhaps the most significant turning point in Paopao‚Äôs career came when she made the decision to transfer from the University of Oregon to South Carolina. Leaving behind a program where she had spent three years was not an easy choice, but it ultimately proved to be a pivotal moment in her career.
‚ÄúEntering the transfer portal was a huge decision, but I knew it was the right one,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúComing to South Carolina has been one of the best decisions I‚Äôve made. The coaches, the teammates, the culture here‚Äîeverything has been such a good fit for me.‚Äù
Te-Hina Paopao: South Carolina Basketball
Since joining the Gamecocks, Paopao has become a cornerstone on the team, contributing to their 2024 NCAA championship victory . Playing for a program with such a rich tradition of success has only fueled her desire to excel.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve really loved my time here at South Carolina,‚Äù Paopao said. ‚ÄúI never thought I‚Äôd end up on the East Coast, but the people here are so welcoming, and the culture is all about hard work and discipline. It‚Äôs a great place to grow as a player and a person.‚Äù
Under the leadership of coach Dawn Staley , Paopao has flourished, learning invaluable lessons about leadership, teamwork, and commitment. One moment that stands out in her mind was during last season‚Äôs game against Duke, when coach Staley asked for her input in a decision that would impact the team‚Äôs dynamic.
‚ÄúThere was a point in the game where Coach asked if I was okay with sitting out the rest of the quarter so a younger player could get more experience,‚Äù Paopao recalled. ‚ÄúI was totally fine with it. I understood the bigger picture, and I appreciated how Coach explained her reasoning to me. It really showed me how genuine and respectful she is as a leader.‚Äù
Te-Hina Paopao: Focus On The Present, Vision For The Future
As the 2024 season progresses, Paopao is focused on helping her team navigate a challenging schedule and push toward another national championship. However, her sights are also set on the next chapter: the WNBA.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited about the possibility of playing in the WNBA, but I know I still have work to do,‚Äù Paopao said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad I took the extra year to get my body right and improve my game. I‚Äôm not just preparing for the draft‚ÄîI‚Äôm preparing to compete at the highest level.‚Äù
For Paopao, the goal isn‚Äôt just to make it to the WNBA‚Äîit‚Äôs to make a lasting impact. ‚ÄúI know it‚Äôs a tough league, and I‚Äôm ready for the challenge,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI just want to prove that I belong and do whatever it takes to stay in the league.‚Äù
Te-Hina Paopao: Giving Back To The Next Generation
While basketball remains her primary focus, Paopao is also thinking about her future beyond the court. Inspired by her father‚Äôs work with young people, she is passionate about mentoring and giving back to the community.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve learned so much from others who have poured into my life, and I want to do the same for kids,‚Äù Paopao said. ‚ÄúMy dad works with youth, and I‚Äôd love to follow in his footsteps. I want to be someone who helps guide young people, just as I was guided.‚Äù
When asked to describe herself in three words, Paopao chose: ‚ÄúBlessed, smiley, and beautiful.‚Äù For her, these words reflect the gratitude she feels for her journey, the joy she finds in the game, and the confidence she has in herself‚Äîtraits that will no doubt carry her far, both in basketball and beyond.
As her senior season continues, Te-Hina Paopao‚Äôs dreams are well within reach. With her unwavering focus, her family‚Äôs support, and the lessons learned along the way, she is poised to make a lasting impact in the WNBA and beyond.

author: Betty Terrones
title: Sacerdote es acusado de morder a una mujer por querer tomar la hostia ‚Äúa la fuerza‚Äù en plena misa | | Am√©rica | La Rep√∫blica
text: Sacerdote es acusado de morder a una mujer por querer tomar la hostia 'a la fuerza' en plena misa Cuando el religioso fue interrogado por la Polic√≠a, el sacerdote le inform√≥ al oficial investigador que la mujer lo hab√≠a empujado y que "no soltaba la bandeja de la comuni√≥n". [La FRUTA de los incas, considerada un tesoro de los Andes, es exportada al pa√≠s m√°s RICO del mundo](/mundo/2024/05/24/la-fruta-de-los-incas-considerada-un-tesoro-de-los-andes-es-exportada-al-pais-mas-rico-del-mundo-sudamerica-peru-1099104) [La fruta m√°s consumida del mundo se cultiva en Am√©rica Latina y es exportada a potencias como Estados Unidos y Rusia](/mundo/2024/05/20/la-fruta-mas-consumida-en-el-mundo-es-exportada-a-potencias-mundiales-como-estados-unidos-y-rusia-lrtmus-1758080) El incidente ocurri√≥ en la Iglesia de Santo Tom√°s de Aquino durante la misa. La mujer involucrada, que asist√≠a a la misa de las 10.00 a. m. para la primera comuni√≥n de su sobrina, relat√≥ a la Polic√≠a que el sacerdote la priv√≥ de la comuni√≥n despu√©s de que ella se negara a responder preguntas sobre su confesi√≥n reciente. La situaci√≥n se intensific√≥ cuando la mujer y su pareja del mismo sexo regresaron para la misa de mediod√≠a, momento en el que nuevamente intent√≥ recibir la Eucarist√≠a. Seg√∫n el padre Fidel Rodr√≠guez, la mujer no present√≥ sus manos ni abri√≥ la boca para recibir la hostia, adem√°s de que no dijo "am√©n" cuando √©l pronunci√≥ "cuerpo de Cristo". Al interrogarla sobre su √∫ltima confesi√≥n y recibir respuestas evasivas, el sacerdote decidi√≥ no darle la comuni√≥n y le ofreci√≥ una bendici√≥n en su lugar. Sin embargo, la mujer insisti√≥ y, en un momento cr√≠tico, meti√≥ la mano en el cop√≥n que conten√≠a las hostias, lo que llev√≥ al sacerdote a morderla para evitar la profanaci√≥n. ‚ÄúLa mord√≠, no lo niego. Me estaba defendiendo a m√≠ mismo y al sacramento", afirm√≥ el sacerdote. Foto: Freepik/ref. PUEDES VER: [Chile es el √∫nico pa√≠s de Am√©rica Latina en agotar todas sus reservas de recursos naturales de 2024] ¬øQu√© dijo la di√≥cesis de Orlando sobre el incidente que involucra al sacerdote? Un comunicado proporcionado por la di√≥cesis de Orlando indic√≥ que el sacerdote le pregunt√≥ a la mujer si "hab√≠a asistido al Sacramento de la Penitencia (confesi√≥n)", a lo que ella respondi√≥ que "no era asunto suyo". "En ese momento, el padre Rodr√≠guez ofreci√≥ a la mujer la sagrada comuni√≥n en la lengua. La mujer meti√≥ con fuerza su mano en el recipiente y agarr√≥ unas hostias sagradas, aplast√°ndolas. Teniendo solo una mano libre, el padre Rodr√≠guez luch√≥ por sujetar a la mujer mientras ella se negaba a soltar las hostias. Cuando la mujer lo empuj√≥ y reaccionando ante lo percibido como un acto de agresi√≥n, el padre Rodr√≠guez le mordi√≥ la mano para que soltara las hostias que agarraba. Inmediatamente, se le pidi√≥ a la mujer que se fuera", se√±ala el comunicado. PUEDES VER: [La pir√°mide m√°s antigua del mundo tendr√≠a m√°s de 27.000 a√±os y no est√° en Egipto: ‚ÄúMonta√±a de iluminaci√≥n‚Äù] ¬øQu√© dijeron la demandante y el sacerdote? "No me dio la galleta. No s√© si fue por mi forma de vestir o porque es lo que me gusta", dijo la mujer no identificada. De acuerdo con un informe policial, un testigo les dijo a los oficiales que ella fue se√±alada por su orientaci√≥n sexual y vestimenta. "As√≠ que intent√≥ meterla a la fuerza en su boca. Ella retrocedi√≥ y dijo: ‚Äòno hagas eso‚Äô e intent√≥ agarrarla. Y ah√≠ fue cuando √©l se volvi√≥ loco", indic√≥ el testigo. Por su parte, el padre Fidel le dijo a la Polic√≠a que actu√≥ en defensa propia y para proteger el pan, porque se considera el cuerpo de Cristo. "No te estoy juzgando, te lo estoy preguntando. ¬øConfesaste despu√©s de la misa? Si no confesaste, no puedo darte la comuni√≥n. La mord√≠, no lo niego. Me estoy defendiendo y defendiendo el sacramento", dijo el padre Fidel. Dej√≥ en claro que esa era la √∫nica raz√≥n y les dijo a los oficiales que no la conoc√≠a ni sab√≠a cu√°l era su orientaci√≥n sexual y que eso no le importaba. "No juzgo a nadie", dijo el padre Fidel. El portavoz de la polic√≠a indic√≥ que la oficina del fiscal estatal determinar√° los pr√≥ximos pasos en el caso. Foto: Univision Orlando/captura PUEDES VER: [Rusia descubre las reservas m√°s grandes de petr√≥leo en una regi√≥n reclamada por un pa√≠s de Sudam√©rica] La polic√≠a inici√≥ investigaci√≥n preliminar Cuando fue interrogado por la Polic√≠a, el sacerdote le dijo al oficial investigador que la mujer lo hab√≠a empujado y que "no soltaba la bandeja de la comuni√≥n y la √∫nica manera que pens√≥ para que la soltara fue morderle el brazo", seg√∫n la declaraci√≥n jurada. "En la tradici√≥n cat√≥lica, la Eucarist√≠a es considerada 'la fuente y cumbre' del culto y la fe. Por lo tanto, el acto de participar en la sagrada comuni√≥n requiere una comprensi√≥n, reverencia y devoci√≥n adecuadas. No es algo que una persona pueda exigir arbitrariamente y, ciertamente, no es una simple 'galleta' como la llam√≥ la denunciante", escribi√≥ la di√≥cesis. La Polic√≠a de St. Cloud ha enviado un resumen de los acontecimientos en forma de declaraci√≥n jurada a la oficina del fiscal del Estado para su revisi√≥n. Licenciada en Ciencias de la Comunicaci√≥n. Fui corresponsal en las elecciones de Argentina 2023. Actualmente redactora de la secci√≥n Mundo de La Rep√∫blica. Apasionada por el periodismo deportivo y la danza.

author: Mathilde Cousin
title: Tibo InShape, Kylian Mbapp√©‚Ä¶ Comment ne pas se faire avoir par ces arnaques qui usurpent l'identit√© de personnalit√©s
text:
Tibo InShape a alert√© sur une fausse vid√©o qui d√©tournait sa voix et son image pour promouvoir un jeu en ligne. Face √† la multiplication de ces arnaques, on a demand√© √† un expert des conseils pour les rep√©rer ¬´Ne vous faites pas avoir. ¬ª Mardi soir, le youtubeur Tibo InShape a mis en garde ses abonn√©s contre une fausse publicit√© qui d√©tourne son image et celle de la journaliste Anne-Claire Coudray, pr√©sentatrice du journal t√©l√©vis√© de TF1.
Dans cette fausse vid√©o, on voit le youtubeur le plus suivi de France faire de la pub pour une application de casino en ligne, alors que ces jeux sont interdits en France. La vid√©o est pr√©sent√©e de mani√®re √† laisser penser qu'il s'agit d'un reportage de TF1.
Faites attention √† cette arnaque svp j'ai re√ßu beaucoup de message, ne vous faites pas avoir merci !! üôè pic.twitter.com/Ib3gPvU3HC ‚Äî Tibo InShape (@TiboInShape) November 12, 2024 L'acc√®s √† ce contenu a √©t√© bloqu√© afin de respecter votre choix de consentement En cliquant sur¬´ J'accepte ¬ª, vous acceptez le d√©p√¥t de cookies par des services externes et aurez ainsi acc√®s aux contenus de nos partenaires. Plus d'informations sur la pagePolitique de gestion des cookies J'accepte
Comme l'√©crit Tibo InShape, il s'agit bien d'une arnaque, qui utilise une technique de deepfake : les voix du youtubeur et de la journaliste ont √©t√© manipul√©es et rajout√©es sur leurs images. Les escrocs leur font tenir des propos qu'ils n'ont jamais tenus. Quant √† l'application vant√©e dans cette publicit√©, elle n'appara√Æt plus dans les catalogues d'Apple ni d'Android.
Tibo InShape n'est pas la premi√®re personnalit√© dont l'image est d√©tourn√©e pour vanter une arnaque. Kylian‚Ä¶
Mathilde Cousin

author: Charles Watson, WPVI via CNN Newsource
title: ‚ÄòShe saved my son‚Äôs life‚Äô: Taco Bell manager saves baby who stopped breathing in drive-thru
text:
RICHBORO, Pa. (WPVI) - A family in Pennsylvania says they have a quick-thinking Taco Bell manager to thank for saving their child‚Äôs life.
Natasha Long says the situation started when her 11-week-old baby suddenly stopped breathing while she was in the drive-thru at the fast-food restaurant.
‚ÄúIt was the scariest moment of my entire life,‚Äù Long said.
The mother of two had just finished some errands and decided to grab food when she says she noticed baby Myles struggling for air in the back seat of the car.
‚ÄúI pulled him out and he turned completely blue and was lifeless. At that point I just completely blacked out. I didn‚Äôt know what to do,‚Äù she said.
Fortunately, Long was in earshot of Taco Bell manager Becky Arbaugh, who heard the mother‚Äôs screams and quickly jumped in to give baby Myles CPR.
‚ÄúI ran outside and took the baby,‚Äù Arbaugh said. ‚ÄúI then started to do chest compressions on the baby, and he finally started to breathe.‚Äù
Long said the manager appeared out of nowhere like a guardian angel.
According to Arbaugh, her own scares as a mother helped her prepare for a moment like this.
‚ÄúWhen my kids were little, my daughter had similar incidents. So, I knew what she was feeling, and there was no thought in my mind that the baby wasn‚Äôt going to breathe again,‚Äù Arbaugh said.
Baby Myles did regain his breath and was rushed to Saint Christopher‚Äôs Hospital for treatment.
The next day Long said she called Taco Bell to thank Arbaugh, who she calls her hero.
‚ÄúWe couldn‚Äôt be more grateful to Becky. She saved my son‚Äôs life,‚Äù Long said.
Baby Myles remains in the hospital as doctors try to understand what happened to him.
Meanwhile, Long has been sending videos and pictures to Arbaugh -- who now has a deep bond with the family.
Copyright 2024 WPVI via CNN Newsource. All rights reserved.

author: Marion Sammarcelli
title: Antigone va jouer le dernier gig de sa carri√®re √† Essaim
text:
Apr√®s 15 ans de carri√®re, c'est un clap de fin pour Antigone. Le DJ et producteur fran√ßais a annonc√© cette difficile d√©cision via un post sur Instagram. Il y explique qu'il est temps pour lui de ¬´ clore ce chapitre de sa vie ¬ª, mais il n'√©carte pas la possibilit√© de retourner derri√®re les platines un jour.
Celui qui a particip√© √† l'essor de la techno √† Paris, en √©tant notamment DJ r√©sident de Concrete, a √©galement profit√© de cette publication pour annoncer ses derniers DJ sets √† Paris et ailleurs.
The last dance
Pour sa derni√®re soir√©e, Antigone a donc choisi de se produire dans le nouveau club du 10e de Brice Coudert, Essaim. Il boucle ainsi la boucle. Intitul√©e ‚ÄúThe last dance‚Äù, la soir√©e lui offre la possibilit√© de faire un dernier all night long. Une teuf qui sera sans doute pleine de surprises et o√π il faudra d√©finitivement √™tre le 15 f√©vrier. Un conseil : venez t√¥t, partez tard.

author: Ashley Turner
title: Nic Cage's Son Weston Cage Coppola Hit By Heartbreaking Legal Decision
text:
Weston Cage Coppola, Nicolas Cage 's eldest child, has been dealt a severe blow in his ongoing custody battle with his ex-wife, Hila Cage Coppola. The legal turmoil, which has been unfolding since their divorce in September 2021, reached a turning point this week, threatening Weston's presence in his twin daughters' lives.
According to legal documents obtained by RadarOnline.com , a court order issued by the Superior Court of California in Los Angeles on June 10 has granted Hila sole legal and physical custody of their 4-year-old twin daughters, Venice and Cyress Cage Coppola. The stipulation and order, bearing the signatures of both parties, effectively strip Weston of any custodial rights or visitation privileges.
The document explicitly states that Hila is now "the person who decides about the [twins'] health, education, and welfare." Conversely, the box next to "No Visitation (parenting time)" was checked off under Weston's name, ending his hopes for a meaningful parenting role.
The court's ruling allows Hila "sole decision making powers," granting her the authority to enroll the twins in a kindergarten of her choice, apply for passports on their behalf, and even travel overseas with the children for up to two months without seeking Weston's consent.
While the outcome represents a significant victory for Hila, it also highlights the deep rift between the former couple and their contentious legal battle. In a separate filing just three days prior, on June 7, Weston objected strongly to Hila's request to depose his famous father in the case.
Hila's legal team had sought to question the actor, citing their belief that he possessed "personal knowledge of [Weston's] father's funding of this litigation from the outset to the extent of hundreds of thousands of dollars." However, Weston's lawyers countered, asserting that Cage's testimony was "not relevant to any issue in this matter" and arguing that the actor, "not a party to this case and not a resident of California," should be spared from being dragged into the legal drama.
The objection further stated that the remaining issues, about attorneys' fees and other legal costs, "will be addressed through the bank records and ledger will will be provided to [Hila] by June 21," following a previous court order on May 30. Weston's legal team urged Hila to "withdraw this subpoena to avoid further motions and litigation."
This latest development follows a series of legal maneuvers by both parties, with Cage's lawyers previously refusing Hila's deposition request in May, labeling it "unduly burdensome, harassing, oppressive, vague, and irrelevant." The actor's legal team contended that the request was "grossly overbroad and seeks the wholesale production of Responding Party's bank records that are neither relevant to the subject matter of the action nor reasonably calculated to lead to the discovery of admissible evidence."
The custody battle between Weston and Hila has been a lengthy and bitter affair, with the couple filing for divorce in September 2021, just three years after their marriage in April 2018. Their twin daughters, Venice and Cyress, were born in April 2020, complicating the legal process further.
Related:
Nicolas Cage's Son Under Police Investigation for Allegedly Attacking His Mother 'National Treasure 3' Gets Disappointing Update From Nicolas Cage Nicolas Cage Reacts to Memes About His 'Freakout' Movie Performances As Weston struggles with being denied custody and visitation rights to his daughters, the larger Cage family finds itself embroiled in a web of legal turmoil. Cage and Weston's mother, Christina Fulton, reportedly have yet to meet their granddaughters due to the ongoing "nightmare" battle, so it appears the family is facing a challenging time.
Despite this turmoil, Weston has pledged to take "immense and aggressive action" against the false accusations he claims to have endured throughout his life. "I have been a target of defamation for my entire life. I've stayed quiet, but now that I am facing the worst traducement and defamation yet, I will be taking immense and aggressive action," he told The US Sun , hinting at the potential for further legal battles.

author: En r√©ponse √†
title: Les arr√™ts maladies dans le viseur du gouvernement et de la Cour des comptes, la Sant√© en danger ! - L'AN VERT de Vouziers : √©cologie et solidarit√©.
text: Communiqu√© du [Tour de France de la sant√© ](https://tourdefrancesante.gogocarto.fr/) La Cour des comptes vient de jeter un pav√© dans la mare qui ne peut que satisfaire le gouvernement. Elle pr√©conise de ne pas indemniser les arr√™ts maladie de moins de 8 jours en allongeant le d√©lai de carence dans le public et le priv√©. Rappelons que les arr√™ts maladie sont dans le viseur de Bruno Le Maire depuis plusieurs mois. Il faut bien trouver les 20 milliards d‚Äô√©conomies en 2024, autant voire plus en 2025, chiffres colossaux. Une fois de plus on culpabilise ces malades qui profiteraient du syst√®me. Et on s‚Äôappuie pour cela sur le fameux ¬´ trou de la S√©cu ¬ª et l‚Äôaugmentation du co√ªt des arr√™ts de travail. Cette augmentation, la Cour des comptes elle-m√™me indique qu‚Äôelle est difficile √† analyser, la p√©riode incluant la crise sanitaire COVID, et que d‚Äôautres facteurs interviennent comme la hausse du SMIC et des salaires, l‚Äôaugmentation de la population active et l‚Äôextension du champ aux ind√©pendants et professions lib√©rales. Ce sont l‚Äôexpansion des pathologies chroniques, l‚Äôaccroissement de l‚Äô√¢ge des travailleur-euse-s, qui s‚Äôaccentuera encore avec le report de l‚Äô√¢ge de la retraite √† 64 ans, la d√©gradation des conditions de travail, la souffrance au travail et le burn out, qui conduisent √† l‚Äôaugmentation des arr√™ts de travail not√©e depuis 10 ans. Il y a 700 000 accidents du travail chaque ann√©e, plus de 2 morts par jour. La non-indemnisation des arr√™ts maladie de moins de 8 jours est une aberration sur le plan de la sant√© publique. Beaucoup, ne pouvant se permettre une perte de salaire iront travailler, malades, avec tous les risques inh√©rents, aggravation des pathologies, allongement de leur dur√©e, moins bonne r√©cup√©ration, risque accru d‚Äôaccidents du travail, diffusion de pathologies infectieuses. De quoi creuser un peu plus encore les in√©galit√©s sociales en sant√©. Quant au trou de la S√©curit√© sociale brandi depuis des ann√©es pour justifier les r√©gressions, il tient √† des choix politiques assum√©s : exon√©rations et exemptions de 88 milliards de cotisations sociales en 2024, tol√©rance vis-√†-vis des fraudes aux URSSAF, des dettes patronales, dispositifs comme la prime Macron qui se substituent aux augmentations de salaire et privent la S√©curit√© sociale de cotisations sociales‚Ä¶ La s√©curit√© sociale est malade de son manque de recettes et non de ses d√©penses. Elle est malade de la volont√© du gouvernement et du Medef de privatiser tout ce qui est rentabilisable, de baisser le ¬´ co√ªt du travail ¬ª. Un autre financement est possible : suppression des exon√©rations et exemptions des cotisations patronales, hausse des salaires, √©galit√© salariale homme-femme‚Ä¶ Les indemnit√©s journali√®res en cas d‚Äôarr√™t maladie sont indispensables √† la sant√© de ceux et celles qui travaillent, les remettre en cause √©quivaut √† attaquer le principe m√™me de la s√©curit√© sociale. Les organisations parties prenantes du Tour de France pour la sant√© et les organisations signataires appellent √† une mobilisation citoyenne contre ces mesures, et pour la S√©curit√© sociale et sa r√©appropriation par les usager-√®re-s et assur√©-e-s sociaux. Paris, le 6 juin 2024

author: Syndicated Content
title: Boehringer to lay off salespeople as Humira biosimilar sales lag
text:
By Patrick Wingrove
(Reuters) ‚Äì Boehringer Ingelheim on Thursday said it will lay off some of its salesforce due to poor U.S. sales of its biosimilar version of AbbVie‚Äôs blockbuster arthritis treatment Humira.
The German drugmaker said it planned to reduce its customer-facing teams in favor of a hybrid in-person and virtual sales model by June 30, in large part because pharmacy benefit managers (PBMs) had kept branded Humira on their lists of medicines for reimbursement.
That choice has led to less uptake of biosimilar versions of Humira in the United States, including Boehringer‚Äôs Cyltezo, it said. The company, which has 53,000 employees worldwide, did not provide details on how many people would be laid off.
Despite nine biosimilars being launched in the U.S. last year, AbbVie has held onto more than 98% of the Humira market.
Boehringer launched Cyltezo last July but has only managed to sell 1,487 prescriptions in total since then, according to IQVIA data. Almost 2.8 million Humira prescriptions have been written during the same period.
Humira until recently was the world‚Äôs top selling prescription medicine with annual sales reaching $22 billion in 2022, but has been eclipsed by Merck & Co‚Äôs cancer drug Keytruda.
Unlike easy to manufacture pills that can be copied and sold as generics at a huge discount once patents lapse, complex biologic medicines made from living cells cannot be exactly duplicated and so are known as biosimilars. The introduction of biosimilars was supposed to help cut the price of expensive biotech medicines that go off patent, if not by as much as generics.
The German drugmaker priced its branded and unbranded versions the drug at a 5% and 81% discount to Humira‚Äôs 2023 list price of $6,922 per month.
Swiss drugmaker Sandoz launched its biosimilar Hyrimoz with the same prices as Boehringer and Amgen, whose Amjevita was the first Humira biosimilar to hit the U.S. market, priced at a 5% and 55% discount to Humira.
Boehringer‚Äôs Humira biosimilar was the first to be designated interchangeable by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, meaning it can be substituted for the original without consulting the prescriber.
UnitedHealth Group‚Äôs Optum Rx and Cigna‚Äôs Express Scripts, two of the largest U.S. PBMs, chose to include Cyltezo on their insurance reimbursement lists last year alongside Humira, Hyrimoz and Amjevita.
(Reporting by Patrick Wingrove; Editing by Bill Berkrot)
